alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Clay; Cloud; Coffey; Dickinson; Douglas; Franklin; Geary; Jackson; Jefferson; Lyon; Morris; Osage; Ottawa; Pottawatomie; Riley; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 16 at 7:48PM CDT until June 17 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT FRIDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heat indices of 105 or greater, and overnight lows in the mid to upper 70s. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, north central and northeast Kansas. * WHEN...For today`s Heat Advisory, until 8 PM CDT this evening. For the second Heat Advisory, from noon to 8 PM CDT Friday. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from Saturday afternoon through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While maximum heat indices are expected to be similar each afternoon through Monday, lows will continue to increase this weekend, and this prolonged period of dangerous heat will begin to compound heat-related health concerns.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. A Heat Advisory means that a period of hot weather is expected, during which heat illnesses are possible. Limit your outdoor activities during this time, stay in an air-conditioned building, and check up on relatives and neighbors. While outside, drink plenty of water, wear light and loose fitting clothing, and reduce strenuous activities. An Excessive Heat Watch means that a prolonged period of hot temperatures is expected. The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity will combine to create a dangerous situation in which heat illnesses are possible. Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors.
